should not have access to the opening window's

HTTP header when navigating to the

. This can enhance user privacy.

The

property is primarily used for informational and instructive purposes, helping browsers and web
crawlers make better decisions about how to handle and interpret the links on a web page. It is important
to use appropriate

values to ensure that links behave as intended and adhere to best practices for web
development and SEO (Search Engine Optimization).

- **_self**: the current tab.
- **_blank**: opens in a new tab or window.
- **_parent**: opens in the parent browsing context. If no parent, defaults to **_self**.
- **_top**: opens in the highest browsing context ancestor. If no ancestors, defaults to **_self**.

summary.text:
> **warning** Experimentally available in SDK 52.

Useful as an alternative API when a third-party provider doesn't support Expo Router
but has support for React Navigation via

for existing projects.

Using this API is not recommended for newer projects or integrations since it is
incompatible with Server Side Routing and
[Static Rendering](/router/reference/static-rendering/), and can become challenging to manage while offline or in a low network environment.
A special method used to process URLs in native apps. When invoked, it receives an

object with the following properties:
- **path**: represents the URL or path undergoing processing.
- **initial**: a boolean indicating whether the path is the app's initial URL.

.

summary.text:
Component to render link to another route using a path.
Uses an anchor tag on the web.
Helper method to resolve a Href object into a string.
Redirects to the href as soon as the component is mounted.

Renders the currently selected content.

There are actually two different implementations of Slot:
 - Used inside a _layout as the Navigator
 - Used inside a Navigator as the content

As a custom <Navigator /> will set the NavigatorContext.contextKey to be the current _layout,
we can use this to determine if we are inside a custom navigator or not.
Hook to run an effect whenever a route is **focused**. Similar to [
](https://react.dev/reference/react/useCallback) to avoid running the effect too often.
Memoized callback containing the effect, should optionally return a cleanup function.
